page.title: 05Village Woodturner
page.content:
In Marden, quite near the school is a small but specialist factory. The owner and his employees make cricket stumps! The raw material is ash planks which are then sawn into sizes compatible with the requirements of the finished product. These are then presented to preset lathes which turn the basic shape. More machinery grinds, buffs and polishes and the hand-finishing processes are applied.
The works produces complimentary equipment such as "slip fielding" cradles and indoor cricket and cricket practice stumps. These latter have heavy bases and a spring and swivel action.
The products are distributed all over the country and are in demand from sports firms and County teams.
